You can call me CoviBOT.
I'm CoviBOT!
I'm CoviBOT your assistant.
Coronavirus (COVID-19) is a new coronavirus that has not been previously identified. 'CO' stands for 'corona' 'VI' for 'virus' and 'D' for disease.
Coronavirus disease (COVID19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus.
Coronaviruses are a type of virus.
Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID19) is defined as illness caused by a novel coronavirus now called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARSCoV2)
Coronavirus spreads between people who are in close contact with one another and through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes.

patterns: can someone spread the virus without being sick?
do people carry the virus without symptoms?
responses: Some spread might be possible before people show symptoms; there have been reports of this occurring with this new coronavirus, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads

patterns: can the Corona virus spread from contact with contaminated surfaces or objects?
does the virus survive on objects?
does the virus survive on surfaces?
Can you get infected with the Corona through products or touching surfaces?
Can you get the virus touching objects or surfaces?
Do I need to clean the shopping?
Can you get infected with the Corona by mail (letters, parcels)?
responses: It may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching their own mouth, nose, or possibly their eyes, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads

patterns: can someone who has been quarantined for COVID-19 spread the illness to others?
is someone after quarantined still contagious?
If I get COVID-19, will I then be immune, or could I get re-infected?
responses: Someone who has been released from isolation is not considered to pose a risk of infection to others

patterns: What symptoms should I be on the lookout for?
Can I die from the virus?
Can you die from the virus?
responses: COVID-19 can present with symptoms between two and 14 days following exposure. Symptoms can be similar to a cold or flu with fever, cough and shortness of breath, and can range from a mild cough to severe pneumonia.

patterns: What should I do if I have these symptoms?
Seek help when symptoms are present
responses: DO NOT GO to the hospital! The first step is to contact your primary care physician. They can recommend proper treatment and, if necessary, notify public health officials.

patterns: Who is at most risk for contracting a severe case of Corona virus?
Which categories of people are more at risk?
responses: Anyone can contract COVID-19, but to date, severe cases have mostly been limited to the elderly and those with existing chronic health conditions, such as heart disease, cancer, diabetes and respiratory disease.

patterns: Can poultry carry and transmit coronavirus?
Can chicken carry and transmit coronavirus?
responses: There is no indication that farm animals can become infected with coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) or that they can transmit the virus to humans

patterns: Can my children still play outside with others?
Are chidren at risk when they play?
responses: Children seem to be contributing little to the spread of COVID-19. They can play with others if they do not have any symptoms. Large groups should be avoided.

patterns: Do paracetamol, ibuprofen or other medications help against the novel coronavirus?
is there any vaccine for corona virus covid 19?
responses: Currently, three vaccines are authorized and recommended in the United States to prevent COVID-19: Pfizer BioNTech , Moderna and Johnson & Johnson's Janssen
Paracetamol and ibuprofen do not help to cure the virus but can reduce symptoms of fever, sore throat and malaise.

patterns: Does it make sense to wear face masks to protect yourself?
Is it important to have a face mask?
Does the mask protect from the Corona virus?
Shall I use a face mask when I go out?
responses: Face masks are recommend medical personnel only. Why? You should use special masks that close very well over your nose and mouth, use them precisely and change them regularly. This is almost impossible in daily use.

patterns: Could the incubation period be much longer than 14 days?
How long is the incubation of the virus?
responses: It varies from 2 to 12 days: for safety reasons should be considered  14 days

patterns: What can I do to prevent infection?
What do I do to prevent infection?
What should I do to limit the risk of infection?
responses: The key to handwashing is to wash, with soap, often and wash well for at least 20 seconds.

patterns: Does a dryer help preventing Corona virus?
responses: Hand dryers are not effective in preventing COVID-19, and should be avoided when hands are not properly cleaned

patterns: Is it safe to drink water from fountains?
responses: Public drinking water supplies are safe to drink (should avoid touching the spout and lever around though)

patterns: Can pets be infected with COVID-19?
responses: There is no reason to think that animals might be a source of infection with this new virus.
